text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Pleasantries and platitudes at Beirut economic conference but still no economic detail.
- Christian MPs told to quit in equality push. Protest over "marginalising" by Moslem-dominated cabinet.
- Minister seeks solution to mounting waste.
- Outcome of Beirut economic summit expected today.
- Lebanese and Egyptian middlemen involved in deal to sell military helicopters to Iraq.
- Israel shells areas in south Lebanon.
- U.S. ambassador discusses developments in Lebanon with Lebanese leaders. Says he expects the U.S. State Department to make a decision on Lebanon travel ban within 72 hours.
